Reviews.Title: “Delightfully surprised”
Reviews.Author: fireshepdancer
Reviews.Content: I was booked into the Abba as part of a tour and wasn't expecting it to be so convenient. Everything was exceptional from the helpful staff, the comfortable room, and the tasty meals. Yes, the Wi-Fi was only available in the lobby but there was comfortable seating available. A short walk gets you to the main shopping street and the metro. The staff was very willing to help me with the metro routes to Potsdam and the Turkish Market, which I did on my own. As an independent 73 year old woman, such helpfulness was a bonus. Not all hotels are as obliging or encouraging.

Reviews.Title: “Very tidy hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwiserbia
Reviews.Content: We found the staff very friendly and helpful the rooms are clean and tidy And close to some very nice restaurants the only annoying thing was the WI FI was only free at the lobby

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, spacious rooms, worth the price!”
Reviews.Author: Jerzy N
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the price paid. Very good location, close to the subway station, walking distance form Ku’damm street. May a bit limited variety of dishes for breakfast, but really great quality and tasty food. Comfortable, spacious rooms, nice bathroom. The only small problem, was that there was no free wifi in the room, but fortunately it was possible to access internet at the main hall downstairs. Financial Times available and helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “xmas city break”
Reviews.Author: BRIDGET186638
Reviews.Content: went to berlin with a tour group. the abba hotel location was great near metro and great for shopping,This hotel is perfect rooms were clean and lovely bathroom staff were so nice and helpful. the breakfast was excellent and we met some really nice people in the hotel. i would highly reccomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel 1 block south to kudaam!!!”
Reviews.Author: Omer P
Reviews.Content: All is just excellent in this hotel!!! The location is great for those who prefer the shopping and touring the Kudaam. A bit too west and far to those who prefer the tourist attractions in mitte and in east berlin. The metro or s-bhn are great solutions but traveling takes time. WiFi is available only on the lobby, for 1 hour free, but it's enough. Food is excellent, rooms are clean and large, and service is just beyond words.... Good value, great hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and very convenient”
Reviews.Author: ROHCanberraAust
Reviews.Content: I know that occasionally the Abba Berlin must do something wrong, but I could not find it. We have just spent five nights in room 620 and would definitely recommend the property for its location, facilities and service. We booked a standard room via Agoda and all our requests (non-smoking, high floor, king bed) were fulfilled. The room was spacious and very comfortable and we even had one of the famous chandeliers. The flat screen tv covered most European languages and about four or five in English. The bathroom was well equipped with a wide range of toiletries and a salon-standard hair dryer. We only had breakfast once and at 14 euros per person it was rather expensive. If it is included in the room package it is much better value. Wifi was good and each login lasted for an hour. Additional logins were cheerfully provided by the front desk when we needed them. Location is terrific. The Ku'damm shopping area is only a block away and it is only two blocks to the Savigny-Platz S Bahn station which has excellent links to most of Berlin. It is one stop to the Zoo Bahnhof (with its large bus interchange) and two stops to the Hauptbahnhof. There are several cafes and coffee shops near the station should you be looking for breakfasts, lunches, etc. There were large tour groups staying at the hotel on two of our nights there, however the hotel seemed to handle them very well and if we had not seen a crowd in the lobby we would not have known they were there. A good hotel in a good place for a good price. Recommended

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Best Breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: LovTravelOz
Reviews.Content: Had 2 nights as part of the Cosmos Tour. The room is very clean and good size. Very impressed with the lightings and bed. We had an included dinner at the hotel and it is of the highest standard. Lovely food. The next day, we had breakfast and there are so many choices of hight quality and quantity. The restaurant service is top. Location is fantastic as close to shopping area and metro. Hotel provide free wi-fi as well. The best hotel in the tour. There is a Italian restaurant opposite which is good price and very delicious meal.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Maggiepie
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with a large tour group. When the choice of hotel is in someone else's hands you never know what you will get. We were pleasantly surprised. Our room was a very comfortable size. Even though we were on the first floor on street side our room was quite. It was in a very good location. Only a block away from the Kur'damn which has many many stores and many varied restaurant choices. The hotel breakfast was satisfactory and the staff was quite pleasant. Our large group was in town for a NHL hockey game. The first night the hotel helped arrange a feed of our teams away game in the hotel lobby. All went well. However, the following night there was a "planned" cocktail party at the lobby bar before we left for the O2 World Arena. Although there were four (count 'em four) young woman serving behind the bar it took over ten minutes to get a drink. Very disorganized and one or two were very curt with the patrons. Other than this minor glich it was a good stay. Berlin is a great city and we hope to go back someday. We would most certainly stay at the Abba again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel. Recommended.”
Reviews.Author: Hillary67
Reviews.Content: The room, the location, the food and the service were great. We enjoyed ōur stay!

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mys64
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location - A few steps away from the Ku-Dam, Underground Stations, Supermarkets (Netto and Keiser's) nearby, Good Restaurants and bars only a short walk away - try on Uhlandstrasse for great Sushi, iItalian, russian and many others . The rooms are clean, big and quite. Except for the chandelier which is weird the decore is nice and restful. TV has almost all channels in german (found only BBC news) which is too bad. Breakfast was included in our deal ( I think that if not it is very expensive and not worth is because of the nearby other options) and was great : large selection of food and good coffee. A long line of guests formes as they open at 7:00 but if you come in a bit later the wait is reasonable. Sorry to say that the dinner was horrible - not a good idea to eat dinner there anyway. Staff was very helpful and nice.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: ianilu
Reviews.Content: Stayed 6 nights with my wife-june 2010.Modern hotel -very good location-close to KUDDAM-the shopping street.Very close to underground.Large and clean rooms-good breakfast.Perfect choice for stay in BERLIN.Nice and safe surroundings.I think they have a fitness room.Very efficient staff.Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, excellent service ,nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: experiencematter
Reviews.Content: Abba hotel is easy to access and is surrounded by many restaurants - easy to walk around and enjoy evenings after work . 15 minutes by taxi to IFA fair & max 30 to Tegel airport Rooms are very nice -i liked the wooden floor instead of carpets The bar at the entrance is quite nice and great service for a drink after work ( a bit difficult to sit on tall red armchairs but allowed us to make fun of the ones that sat on them ) Breakfast - could be a bit better for a restaurant in Berlin - i think was sufficient ,but not the most delicious one Coffee was not good at all - despite a WMF machine ; teas were so so ; Wireless in the lobby was allowed free only for an hour ; and as usually in Europe is never free in the rooms which is a real turn off ;

Reviews.Title: “Great, Great, Great...”
Reviews.Author: TeamFuchs
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel with my wife and my year old son. The hotel was very clean and modern and the staff cheery and nice. The room was very nice and clean with a double bed and even though it was on the first floor facing the street was very quiet. As we were traveling with our son the room was also equipped with a large crib and all the bedding. The staff was very accommodating as we needed boiling water for the baby formula and even the night concierge was always waiting with a smile to help at 5:00AM. The hotels location is a winner, right off Cu-Dam and a short stroll from all major public transportation stations. All in all, a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel and well located”
Reviews.Author: PeterLanky
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 2 nights as part of a central European tour. Hotel is located one street away from the popular Kurfurstendamm and about 10 mins walk from Uhlandstrasse underground station. Rooms very modern with flat screen TV incorporating radio which meant we could go to sleep with music on. Quality map of Berlin provided by hotel as well as information on where to eat. Room was nice and modern with good air conditioning and lots of supplies provided in bathroom. Could only be faulted by having no kettle, but this seems the norm in mainland Europe. Very nice breakfast provided, but is quite expensive if paid for separately, though ours came with our package

Reviews.Title: “Good location, strange room”
Reviews.Author: OhioRon
Reviews.Content: This is our first time to stay at one of the Abba hotels. There are several people in our group, and most of us were assigned to rooms that are outfitted for someone in a wheelchair. There are some benefits to this. For one, the room is quite large. The bed is also large, and it's quite comfortable. The room and bath were very clean. However, the bathroom took some getting used to. There is no shower/tub nor a shower stall. Instead, there is a shower nozzle on the wall next to the basin. There is no shower curtain, nor any place where one could be put. When you take a shower, water sprays over much of the bathroom (which is quite large). It would not be possible for someone else to use the basin or the toilet while someone is showering. I've never seen this arrangement. The breakfast buffet doesn't open until 7:00. A really long line formed and it took a lot of time to get the food. Unlike some buffets, this one is cafeteria style. You stand in line and, when you get up to the food, you go down the line and pick what you want. If you want to get another roll or some yogurt, you presumably would need to stand in line again. There were not nearly enough seating places for the breakfast buffet. There were apparently three different tour groups staying in this hotel when we were there, and I guess all went to breakfast when it opened at 7:00. I was wondering if there was another place to take the food and sit down, but apparently not.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel friendly helpful staff good quality and everything u need”
Reviews.Author: BenJohnson66
Reviews.Content: As the tiitle suggests this hotel was excellent the loccation in West berlin lends the hotel to be the perfect place if shopping for designer goods then again Berlin has such a well orchestrated transport system Anywhere in Berlin is within Easy reach by train Tube tram or Bus (6.8E per day unlimited travel card) and as capital cities go for Culture vultures- a long weekend in Berlin is not long enough

Reviews.Title: “good hotel would stay again”
Reviews.Author: LuxTraveller
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel based on the reviews on TA and they are accurate. The hotel is modern and functional 4 star. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The breakfast buffet was good and was included in our price. The hotel is about 10 minute walk from the Ubhan and there is a busstop 249 just around the corner taht will bring you to the zoo and then you can get the 100 or 200 bus to the Reichstag and other sites. There are a number of good restaurants around the corner from the hotel (out of the hotel take 2 right tunrs and head towards the chruch). We ate in local, italian and also a diner and the food was very good. We had a room at the back of the hotel which was very quiet but very cold. There is a spa in the basemeent which we didnt use. Overall we would stay in the hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, but with few problems”
Reviews.Author: Ofer2222
Reviews.Content: We stayed int this hotel for a week. The room was comfortable but not cozy. The floor was somewhat dirty and there was too much dust, but everything else- spotless. The breakfast buffet was great. The Wi-Fi costs too much, (10 Euro per day !), but you can use it at the lobby for free for 20 minutes. Not very comfortable and inviting. As for the staff, they weren't very kind and helpful: We asked for a kettel for the room to heat water for our baby, but they didn't provide it, so we had to go down every day to the bar with bottles to ask to fill them up. Another problem was our late check in: there was no bell boy to assist with the luggage, and there was only one staff member who could not help efficiently to the long queue. The location is very good, a block away from the KuDamm boulevard, but is rather far from the city center-Mitte, so you have to take the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, but sparse”
Reviews.Author: Webeh09
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location, which feels safe at night. The rooms are clean and a free continental breakfast is offered. However, the hotel lacks many of the basis necessities that a customer would need, such as body lotion. Also, internet is not free (20 minutes free in the lobby, requiring a password/code) and there is no business center. If I were to stay in Berlin again, I would choose a different hotel because of these inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: travellady84
Reviews.Content: Modern, very clean, great staff, strong A/C, beautiful rooms, on a quite street, overall a great stay. The hotel and staff really made this place charming.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, modern and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: Sackville
Reviews.Content: Not a bad choice given that I was here on business (only 1 night) but the hotel was exceedingly clean with comfortable rooms and well equipped bathroom. Breakfast was reasonable with emphasis on continental. Apart from the location being a little boring it was a perfectly pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeanette_Goz
Reviews.Content: We loved our three nights in the Abba hotel. It is a small, clean & modern hotel. Our bedroom was spacious and had large windows with a pretty view. The bathroom was clean and modern. Breakfast was delicious and there was a great variety of food to choose from every morning. 2 minutes away from the hotel is a great internet cafe which we used daily at reasonable prices. The location of the hotel is OK, we would have preferred to stay in the trendy area of Mitte (but didn't as accomodation in the Mitte is far more expensive!!). However, overall I would definately recommend this hotel. It is excellent value for its price.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanest hotel I have ever stayed in..........”
Reviews.Author: ianelstub3
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights, my first visit to Berlin and because of its proximity to the U-Bahn (Uhlandstrasse station) is in an ideal position for exploring. The room and bathroom were spotless. The bed was big and comfortable and the room had everything you need apart from maybe tea and coffee making facilities. The staff were efficient and courteous and the breakfast was just terrific. Wifi was extra but not prohibitively expensive and easy to negotiate. Will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a good trip”
Reviews.Author: drleb
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nicely located and overall was a good value. We purchased a package and wanted to extend it one day, they did so at a great rate and allowed us to keep the family room instead of the triple we booked. Only problem we had was that the hotel did not 'remember' any of the 'package' we bought. We had to ask for all the items that came with our package (other hotels often have them ready upon arrival). We were supposed to get tours or the city, city passes, free internet, welcome drinks, etc. We had to ask for each item and they did not believe us until they checked their reservation to see adn realized it was part of our package. They even tried to charge us for breakfast which was included as well. Overall, they were generally pleasant and sometimes helpful, but could not make any dinner recommendations in the area. Best part of the hotel was the size of the room (big), it was quiet, well situated in Berlin and a good deal. Despite all the hassle with the front desk staff, we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but the wifi is not free”
Reviews.Author: CHLOEHARA
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was very good. I liked the wooden froors (so much cleaner than carpeting) and the fact that the windows opened even on the 7th floor. One night we decided to eat at the hotel restaurant: the service was very slow and my pasta was so undercooked that I had to send it back to the kitchen. The worst part was that I had to pay 38 euros for using the wifi facilities of the hotel for the 4 days of my stay. It didn't occur to me to ask as all hotels I have been to in the last 3 years offer free wifi!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent rest for exploring Berlin, located in a nice area”
Reviews.Author: CountingSchooler
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value if you're booking for under 100 euros and want a clean, quiet and new hotel in Berlin. It would be a great value if it included the freebies that are fast becoming standard like wifi, but the free newspapers in the lobby make up for it - English papers are present in addition to the German dailies. Per the uploaded photos, the room looks great. Toiletries in the washroom are fantastic, as the Travelling Companion indicated, and the washroom is decently sized. Regarding location, it's in an area around several hotels - it's a 5 to 15 minute walk down from Savignyplatz S-bahn (depending on your luggage and walking speed), and a half the distance if you are going to instead start your adventures from the terminus of the U1 line; not in the thick of action, but in a neighbourhood that felt very safe. And the room in the back of the hotel was wonderfully quiet. We noticed our neighbour checked in with a dog, but either it was well-behaved or the sound-proofing was good as we didn't hear a thing. Only major downsides are the surcharge for wifi (use the internet cafe across the street instead, plus side is that the hotel staff suggested the same thing!), and the breakfast was overpriced (in my opinion, a "regular" hotel charging 10 euros for breakfast is charging far too much). Those downsides didn't cloud the visit though - it was a place where we got great sleep, managed to store luggage for the last day running around Berlin and it contributed to a fantastic 2-night visit in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “ABBA HOTEL BERLIN POOR STANDARDS”
Reviews.Author: breakmansheffield
Reviews.Content: I do not normally complain, would rather commend but feel I have to have my say. Stopped at ABBA hotel for 4 nights one double one twin. Double ready on arrival twin not which was ok. Came back later room given was another double. Told to part the beds myself. They would not, so receptionist came back up to the room with scissors. Was unable to part bed not sure what they hoped to achieve with scissors. Never once saw reception staff smile the entire stay, nor the waiter staff at breakfast. The rooms are small and the bathroom minute. Do not expect to lay out in the bath you have no chance. Bits on the wooden floor for the 4 days and bathroom not cleaned properly. Beds are comfortable but if you have someone above you who wears heels they may as well be in your room Rooms are very hot and at this time of year air con turned off, beware you cannot open the windows due to traffic noise. I know its in a city but the rooms are far to hot to not have the windows open, so 4 nights of disturbed sleep. After reading previous reviews was expecting a really good hotel, we are used to 4 Star hotels, sorry this is not 4 star I would say it compares to IBIS standards at 4 star prices Also note the hotel is not central compared to other 4 star hotels in Berlin of the same price and quality. I will definitely return to Berlin what a fantastic city, but not to the ABBA hotel

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: native_ly
Reviews.Content: It's a new cozy hotel with very friendly staff! We had a normal extra bed for our 13 yo doughter and not a cot as in other hotels. Hotel is centrally located and there is a supermarket close to it. The room has parquet flooring - warm, nice and comfortable. Good breakfast. Air conditioning system works great. The only drawback - no coffee making facilities in room, so if you want tea or coffee at night, you need to go out... and if it's cold outside? And internet.. it should be free in 2010!

Reviews.Title: “The hotel made our stay in Berlin into a great one”
Reviews.Author: rose1055118
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff was very helpful. All our requests were fully answered.The room was clean,the breakfast was good and we felt like being home for a week. Its location is excellent. We recommend it and hope to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay at fantastic rooms”
Reviews.Author: uri_fi
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated 5-10 minutes walking to Ku-Dam street (Main shopping street). It comfortably has access to the U-Bahn and S-bahn so getting anywhere in town was easy. We arrived at the hotel after a red eye flight and got in at 9am. They already had a room ready for us even though check-in was only at 2pm. The staff was friendly and helped us with first day orientation in town. The whole hotel was recently refurbished and redone and looks fantastic. Very modern with a nice (yet basic) fitness center, sauna and jacoozi. Breakfast was very good, varied and had something for everyone. All in all it was a great place to stay at with a few nice eating spots all around (oliver platz and more)

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff - a couple of drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: debsky
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel and the staff is very efficient and helpful. My only complaints are that the tub is so high it was really frightening getting in and out. Also - I was there attending one of the biggest tradeshows in Europe and they only had one iron for the entire hotel. This is very unusual for a European hotel and made things difficult. Other than that - I can't say enough how helpful the staff was - I travel at least once a month and this was one of the best teams.

Reviews.Title: “Best sleep in a hotel, great staff, very modern and clean”
Reviews.Author: juli-scot
Reviews.Content: We kicked our 10 day holiday in Germany off with Berlin and stayed in the Abba Berlin Hotel for 2 nights. Received a very warm welcome and could check in early, which was good because we had a long journey already. the room was very spacious compared to many modern hotels of same category, clean and had a modern decor. The bathroom was not huge but nicely decorated with a wide choice of toiletries. We even got a free welcome drink at the bar on the evening of arrival! Breakfast was great, you could choose from a big variety of food, I especially liked the fresh fruit and veg which you don't always get this fresh. I had the best sleep in a hotel ever in those beds. We had a big king bed, very comfortable and we felt well rested with a day of sightseeing ahead. The hotel is conveniently located only one street away from the Ku'Damm, one of the main shopping streets with plenty of restaurants around. Only a few minutes walk to the next underground station. I would definately recommend and will be back the next time in Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “this hotel is very clean and excellent for it's value.”
Reviews.Author: gad666
Reviews.Content: the hotel is located in a nice quite place and very close to the center. it's a very clean and nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excelent Hotel! Recomanded!”
Reviews.Author: kfir25
Reviews.Content: Excelent hotel, i was treveled with my girlfriend the hotel is execelent for couples. very good service everyting i asked in the reception there glad to help me! good hotel, modern. good breakfast if you compare other hotels in europe. nice variety of food. the room was very clean the only thing that bother me is that they didnt clean the floor in all the 5 days i stayed. except that i enjoyed my staying in the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good value for money”
Reviews.Author: tvovtsuk
Reviews.Content: Amazing hotel. Excellent location. Polite Staff. Good breakfast. Room for three, is a room designed for the handicap, so there is no bath in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Spatious, New, Clean, Freindly Place to be”
Reviews.Author: Aaron F
Reviews.Content: Arrived in Berlin at the beginning of what was supposed to be 1 week in Germany and Czech republic. Our check in was very smooth a side from road construction blocking the on street hotel loading zone. My german is awful and who ever I approached at the desk, bar or restaurant always was able to help me in english. Our room was modern and interesting, very well kept and spacious. It was nice to have heat and AC in the room because for as cold and dreary the Berlin weather was, the room got stuffy at night until we ran the air. The location is nice, in West City and has good food, drink and shopping nearby. We walked to everything touristic we wanted to see in the center of town, but it is not a short walk. We could have rode the mass transit which is trains and buses close by, but we perferred the long walks. We did drive to the East Side Gallery though, it would have been out of reach. Parking is below the hotel and directly accessible from the hotels elevators and stair. Breakfast was quite ample by most european hotel standards and was always fresh. The dining room is the hotel restaurant so there was plenty of seating and there was breakfast staff on hand if you need help. The Bar was fantastic, we enjoyed Roman the bartenders company, drinks, his attention to detail and his love for his work. All in all this is a great place to stay, eat and drink. There were other facilities on site including a spa but I didn't take advantage of them. I don't like having to pay for WiFi, ad if I do i don't lke the system of tie block that are commen to more than this hotel. But the internet worked well, had good connection and good speed. I also think that 15 euro a day for parking in a hotel lot is excesive, but it was easy. Really liked the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spotless business hotel but maybe a bit isolated for first time tourists”
Reviews.Author: Jamezon
Reviews.Content: Loosely speaking the hotel is fairly central but if you are inexperienced with the city, it is maybe a bit of a walk to the action, maybe 10mins to Zoologischer Garten station, a major S-Bahn/U-Bahn interchange. Savignyplatz U-Bahn is probably slightly closer. There are supermarkets and bars/restaurants nearby which is good and many at Ku'damm of course. The hotel itself is a very modern building and still has a 'new' feeling. I would have to disagree with the reviewer who said bad staff, all my questions were answered and they were willing to help out by speaking English. The room was a good size, spotlessly clean but laminate floors were not good for the grit and snow! Sound-proofing reasonable and comfortable beds. The style is more minimalist than luxurious but comfortable and all required features there (except Tea&Coffee facilities in standard room). There is a bath and shower, with all manner of complimentary toileteries. We had a travelzoo deal which brought the price to €198 for 2 nights. We had dinner on the first night, which was only a single course and not really a 'dinner' so watch out for that but the food was o.k. Breakfast was also included but as the hotel was quite empty, there wasn't much fresh food put out, so some of it was a little stale, but otherwise a decent choice. I would definitely reccomend this hotel for around €80 B&B to travellers familiar with Berlin but if there is no deal available or you are there for the major sites, I would look for a deal in somewhere nearer the centre.

Reviews.Title: “Brand new out the box!”
Reviews.Author: Zannagirl
Reviews.Content: The second stop on our Cosmos tour was in Berlin. We had a last minute change of hotel from the Globus Ramada to the Abba Berlin. Think we got a really good deal. The hotel had only been open for one month. Absolutely spotless with that lovely new smell. It’s situated only about a 5 minute walk from the city centre – the Ku’dam Strasse. Comments on the hotel • Room – very modern – flat screen TV mounted on the wall, 2 x king single beds – incredibly comfortable • WiFi – free • Air conditioned • Minibar with fridge • No tea or coffee making facilities • Breakfast – lovely large dining room with good choice. No toast – don’t think it’s very popular in Germany • Supermarket – less than a block away • Eating places – loads within very close walking distance • No iron or ironing board • Hairdrier – yes • Bathroom – large range of free toiletries • Roomsafe – yes • Location – very central

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but horrible staff”
Reviews.Author: Mrozruska
Reviews.Content: Great hotel which opened just 4 months ago. So all the equipment, rooms, public are are really really great, rooms are nice and large, breafkast very good..... but staff absolutelly horrible. From check-in until check-out disastear. No greating, no how are you, no thank you. Worst was check-out were I heared only Hmmm.... (lady called Kari¨/Kare somthing like this). I had to ask all the questions she should have asked. And this is dissapointing me most - you can have as great hotel as you have but if the staff does not know who to behave....even for me it looks like they were bored that they have to see clients - than you can foget to be 4*.

Reviews.Title: “Most recommanded!!!”
Reviews.Author: Ganit_w
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel as a second option since the one we chose was fully booked, and didn't have too many expectations. When we got there we realized we probably got a much better deal... the hotel is new, clean, specious and well located. Even in a realy rainy weather, you can use the passage that connects the nearby street and the Ko'Dam, which is a great plus. You have many goo restaurants nearby, if you don't feel like going far for a meal. The breakfast is generous and very good. The rooms are clean really nice and big To make things short - if you go to Berlin - this is a great value for money , and your stay will surely be pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: yarondo
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights in the Abba hotel Berlin and it was very good. The staff was very helpful and spoke English. Good breakfast which was diverse, tasty and constantly refilled. Very comfortable bed .In the shower you find everything you need ( I mean EVERYTHING ). To bus stop was about 600 meter and about 10 min walk from U-bahn. The supermarket was very close to the hotel (200 meter).

Reviews.Title: “a very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: veredka
Reviews.Content: good location neer shopping. hi-tech design. new!!! new!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and a wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: karmincar
Reviews.Content: Spent six nights in the Abba hotel Berlin and it was excellent. The rooms were very clean, the staff was incredibly helpful and spoke excellent English. but the highlight has got to be the fantastic breakfast which was diverse, tasty and constantly refilled. Bed was very comfortable. Location is pretty good. Close to a bus stop and about 10 min walk from U-bahn.

HotelInfo.Name: Abba Berlin Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Lietzenburger, 89, 10719 Berlin, Germany
